types.title: Depression
types.description: Depression, also known as major depressive disorder or clinical depression, is a common and serious mood disorder.

details.introduction: Depression (major depressive disorder) is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. Fortunately, it is also treatable. Depression causes feelings of sadness and/or a loss of interest in activities you once enjoyed. It can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems and can decrease your ability to function at work and at home.
symptoms: Loss of interest or pleasure in hobbies and activities.
Difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions.
Insomnia, early-morning wakefulness, or sleeping too much.
Thoughts of death or suicide, or suicide attempts.
Aches or pains, headaches, cramps, or digestive problems without a clear physical cause and/or that do not ease even with treatment.
causes: Biological differences: People with depression appear to have physical changes in their brains.
Brain chemistry: Neurotransmitters are naturally occurring brain chemicals that likely play a role in depression.
Hormones: Changes in the body's balance of hormones may be involved in causing or triggering depression.
Inherited traits: Depression is more common in people whose blood relatives — such as a parent or grandparent — also have the condition.
Life events: Trauma, loss of a loved one, a difficult relationship, or any stressful situation may trigger depression.

types.title: Anxiety
types.description: Anxiety is a normal and often healthy emotion. However, when a person regularly feels disproportionate levels of anxiety, it might become a medical disorder.

details.introduction: Anxiety is a mental health condition characterized by intense feelings of worry, fear, or apprehension. It is a normal and adaptive response to stress and can be beneficial in some situations, but when it becomes excessive and interferes with daily life, it can be considered a disorder.
A group of conditions associated with the elevation or lowering of a person's mood, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
A TEST of conditions associated with the elevation or lowering of a person's mood, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
